countries.name: China
countries.information: the People's Republic of China (the People's Republic of China), referred to as China, was founded on October 1, 1949

sport.name: Swimming
sport.information: Swimming is an individual or team sport and event. Competitive swimming is one of the most popular sports worldwide.

countries.name: America
countries.information: The United States of America ( The United States ) is the capital city of Washington, D.C.

sport.name: Athletics
sport.information: Athletics is a group of sporting events that involves competitive running, jumping, throwing, and walking.

countries.name: Japan
countries.information: Japan (Japan), referred to as Japan, the capital of Tokyo, is an arc of island countries located in the west coast of the Pacific Ocean extending from northeast to southwest

sport.name: Gymnastics
sport.information: Gymnastics is a sport that includes physical exercises requiring balance, strength, flexibility, agility, coordination, and endurance.

countries.name: Australia
countries.information: The Commonwealth of Australia (The Commonwealth of Australia) is referred to as Australia, the capital city of Canberra

sport.name: Cycling
sport.information: Cycling, also known as bicycling or biking, is the use of bicycles for transport, recreation, exercise, and sport.

countries.name: France
countries.information: The French Republic (French: La Republique francaise), the capital of Paris, is located in Western Europe

sport.name: Basketball
sport.information: Basketball is a team sport in which two teams, most commonly of five players each, opposing one another on a rectangular court, compete with the primary objective of shooting a basketball.

countries.name: Netherlands
countries.information: Kingdom of the Netherlands (Dutch: Koninkrijk der Nederlanden; English: The Kingdom of the Netherlands), short for the Netherlands, the capital of Amsterdam.

sport.name: Football
sport.information: Football is a team sport played between two teams of eleven players with a spherical ball. It is played by 250 million players in over 200 countries and dependencies, making it the world's most popular sport.
